Welcome on the home page of *Extreme Value Analysis* 2027 (EVA 2027). EVA is a biennial international conference on extreme value analysis, probabilistic and statistical models and their applications. The 15th edition  will be hosted by [HEC Montréal](www.hec.ca) in downtown Montréal (Québec, Canada) at the [Hélène-Desmarais building](https://www.hec.ca/en/campus/helene-desmarais/index.html) from Monday July 5th until Friday July 9th, 2027.


Satellite workshops and courses will take place on Sunday, July 4th,and the week before the conference starts.


The inception of EVA dates back to Vimeiro meeting in Portugal in 1983 in August 31st--September 14th. Further conference in the field were organized in Oberwolfach with the 1987 Conference on *Extremewertheorie*, and the Gaithersburg 1993 Conference on Extreme Value Theory and its Applications.

Previous editions of EVA took place in:

- Göteborg, Sweden (1998)
- Leuven, Belgium (2001)
- Aveiro, Portugal (2004)
- [Göteborg, Sweden (2005)](http://www.math.ku.dk/~mikosch/maphysto_extremes_2005/extremes.html)
- Bern, Switzerland (2007)
- [Fort Collins, Colorado, USA (2009)](http://www.stat.colostate.edu/graybillconference2009/)
- [Lyon, France (2011)](http://eva2011.univ-lyon1.fr/)
- Shanghai, China (2013)
- [Ann Arbor, Michigan, USA (2015)](https://sites.lsa.umich.edu/eva2015/)
- [Delft, Netherlands (2017)](http://www.eva2017.nl/)
- [Zagreb, Croatia (2019)](https://web.math.pmf.unizg.hr/eva2019/)
- [Edinburgh, UK (2021, virtual)](https://www.maths.ed.ac.uk/school-of-mathematics/events/past-events/eva-2021)
- [Milano, Italy (2023)](https://dec.unibocconi.eu/research/extreme-value-analysis-eva-2023)
- [Chapel Hill, North Carolina, USA (2025)](https://eva2025.unc.edu/)

## Location

```{r}
#| eval: true
#| echo: false
#| out-width: '90%'
library(leaflet)
leaflet() |>
  addTiles() |>  # Add default OpenStreetMap map tiles
  addMarkers(lng=-73.5644991,
             lat=45.5027154,
             popup="HEC Montréal - Hélène-Desmarais building")
```


The address of the venue is 501, rue de la Gauchetière Ouest, Montréal, H2Z 1Z5.


The downtown campus is easily reached by public transport, either via [metro](https://www.stm.info/en/info/networks/metro) ([Square-Victoria-OACI station](https://www.stm.info/fr/infos/reseaux/metro/square-victoria-oaci), orange line), or from the [Gare Centrale REM station](https://rem.info/en/travelling/stations/gare-centrale).


The coffee breaks and standing lunches will take place in the A.373 Centre de conférence Claude-Séguin, located next to the *Entrée Famille Karim (boul. René-Lévesque Ouest).*

Plenary talks will take place in room A.335 Amphithéâtre Rachelle et Alain-Paris.

Registration will be at room A.393.

Contributed and invited talks will be in classrooms

- C.403 Louis-R.-Chênevert
- C.409 Gilles-Labbé
- C.415 Pierre Fitzgibbon
- C.406 Josée-Fiset
- C.412 Malette

Please bring a copy of your presentation on a USB stick at least 15 minutes before the scheduled start of your session.

## Scientific committee

The scientific committee of the event will allocate invited sessions and plenary talks. It consists of between 15 and 20 experts in the field.

## Local organizing committee

- [Léo Belzile](https://lbelzile.bitbucket.io) (HEC Montréal)
- [Rafal Kulik](https://mysite.science.uottawa.ca/rkulik/)
- [Johanna G. Nešlehová](https://www.math.mcgill.ca/neslehova)
- [Michaël Lalancette]()

# Sponsors

We gratefully acknowledge financial support from

- the [*Centre de Recherche Mathématiques*](https://www.crmath.ca/)
- [HEC Montréal](https://www.hec.ca)
- the [Canadian Statistical Science Institute (CANSSI)](https://canssi.ca/) with support from [NSERC](https://www.nserc-crsng.gc.ca/index_eng.asp),


```{r}
#| eval: true
#| echo: false
#| layout-ncol: 3
#| out-width: '90%'
#| fig-align: 'center'
knitr::include_graphics(path = "files/CRM_logo.png")
knitr::include_graphics(path = "files/CANSSI_logo.png")
knitr::include_graphics(path = "files/HEC_logo.png")
# knitr::include_graphics(path = "files/SSC_logo.png")

```
